page.title: 18THE ROMANS IN SOUTH SHIELDS
page.content:
{Arbeia}was built as a fort with many granaries to supply the garrison on nearby{Hadrian's Wall}. Its site was easily defended, being on a hill overlooking the river,with the sea to the east and marshes to the south.
Excavations began in the 19th century and the most recent have uncovered the {West Gateway.}There are plans to reconstruct this and some ramparts. The small{Museum}contains artefacts found on the site, showing how the Romans lived. We know that at one time the fort was occupied by cavalry, and burials and cremations occurred. Other finds include jewellery and remains of food including dormice, quails, oysters and wild boar. Clearance of poorer Victorian housing has helped archaeologists extend the dig and more finds are hoped for.
